== Independent guides ==

These guides are independently maintained. Much of their content is included in the Ubuntu community help pages, but newer material in these guides may not be.

* <nowiki>[[https://thelinuxbook.com/ | The Linux Desktop Guide - Last change: 2025-06-15 ]]</nowiki> - The Linux Desktop Guide

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuguide.org|Ubuntuguide]]</nowiki> - Comprehensive guide for Ubuntu, since 2005.

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Kubuntuguide|Kubuntuguide]]</nowiki> - Comprehensive guide for Kubuntu, since 2007.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntugeek.com/|Ubuntu Geek]]</nowiki> - a wealth of information, but in blog format

* <nowiki>[[http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/|OMG! Ubuntu]]</nowiki> - news, tips, and reviews in blog format

* <nowiki>[[http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/index|Psychocats' Ubuntu GNU/Linux Resources]]</nowiki> - a collection of random tutorials for Ubuntu

* <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuguide.net/|Ubuntu Sharing]]</nowiki> - tips in blog format

* <nowiki>[[http://owlcroft.com/ubuntu/|The Owlcroft Ubuntu Help & Advice Pages]]</nowiki> - from choosing through maintaining

* <nowiki>[[http://tldp.org/guides.html | The GNU/Linux Documentation Project Guides]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.makelinux.net/kernel_map/ | Interactive map of GNU/Linux kernel]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/36671/how-do-i-pre-install-ubuntu-for-someone-oem-install | How do I pre-install Ubuntu for someone else (= OEM install)?]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Linux_Distribution_Timeline.svg | GNU/Linux Distribution Timeline]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://commons.oreilly.com/wiki/index.php/Ubuntu_Hacks/Getting_Started | O'Reilly Ubuntu Hacks (March 2008) ]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.ict-innovation.fossfa.net/wiki/public-wiki/foss-certification-training-material/lpi-testing-engines | LPI Training Materials and Practice testing engines]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://fullcirclemagazine.org/ | The Ubuntu Full Circle on line magazine]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.howtogeek.com/119219/an-introduction-overview-of-unity-in-ubuntu-12.04-for-beginners-video/ | An Introduction-Overview of Unity in Ubuntu 12.04 for Beginners (Video)]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.scribd.com/doc/8461367/Linux-Console-Commands | Cheat Sheet containing most commonly used commands in GNU/Linux]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://files.fosswire.com/2007/08/fwunixref.pdf | Second cheat Sheet]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://rc.arizona.edu/sites/default/files/bash_cheat_sheet.pdf | Third cheat sheet]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.tecmint.com/60-commands-of-linux-a-guide-from-newbies-to-system-administrator/ | 60 Linux commands for newbies and system administrators]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/lib/libX11/log/nls/en_US.UTF-8/Compose.pre|FreeDesktop]]</nowiki> - Official X.Org compose key sequences. Use this as reference to FreeDesktop (used as the default in many systems).

* <nowiki>[[http://www.dmoz.org/Computers/Software/Operating_Systems/Linux/Distributions/Ubuntu/FAQs,_Help,_and_Tutorials/|DMOZ FAQs, Help, and Tutorials]]</nowiki> -- open source directory of wikis and help guides for Ubuntu

* <nowiki>[[http://explainshell.com/ | Explain Shell breaks down Linux commands so you can understand them better]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.commandlinefu.com/commands/browse | commandlinefu.com is the place to record those command-line gems that you return to again and again.]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://steve-parker.org/sh/sh.shtml | Steve Parker's Bourne / Bash shell scripting tutorial]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://www.edx.org/course/linuxfoundationx/linuxfoundationx-lfs101x-introduction-1621 | Introduction to GNU/Linux - LinuxFoundationX]]</nowiki> 

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ComposeKey|Compose Key Sequences]]</nowiki> - Compose Key Sequences

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Mount/USB | How to mount USB devices]]</nowiki>
